Home > misc > dist > stk_filldist.m

stk_filldist

PURPOSE

STK_FILLDIST computes the (discrete) fill distance of a set of points

SYNOPSIS

function fd = stk_filldist(x, y)

DESCRIPTION 

 STK_FILLDIST computes the (discrete) fill distance of a set of points

 CALL: D = stk_filldist(X, Y)

    computes the fill distance D of X using the "test set" Y. More
    precisely, if X is an n x d matrix and Y an m x d matrix, then

       D = max_{1 <= j <= m} min_{1 <= i <= n} norm(X(i,:) - Y(j,:)),

    where norm(.) denotes the Euclidean norm in R^d. The fill distance
    is also known as the "minimax" criterion.

 CALL: [D, ARGMAX] = stk_filldist(X, Y)

    also returns the value ARGMAX of the index j for which the maximum
    is obtained. (If the maximum is obtained for several values of j,
    the smallest is returned.)

 See also: stk_dist, stk_mindist

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:

0047 function fd = stk_filldist(x, y)
0048 
0049 stk_narginchk(2, 2);
0050 
0051 if isstruct(x), x = x.a; end
0052 if isstruct(y), y = y.a; end
0053 
0054 % call MEX-file
0055 fd = stk_filldist_mex(x, y);
0056 
0057 end % function stk_filldist
0058 
0059 %%
0060 % Two non-empty matrices are expected as input arguments
0061 
0062 %!error stk_filldist(0.0)            % incorrect nb of arguments
0063 %!error stk_filldist(0.0, 0.0, pi)   % incorrect nb of arguments
0064 %!error stk_filldist(0.0, [])        % second arg is empty
0065 %!error stk_filldist([], 0.0)        % first arg is empty
0066 
0067 %%
0068 % Check that ".a" structures are accepted
0069 
0070 %!test
0071 %! d = 3; x = rand(7, d); y = rand(20, d);
0072 %! fd1 = stk_filldist(x, y);
0073 %! fd2 = stk_filldist(struct('a', x), struct('a', y));
0074 %! assert(stk_isequal_tolabs(fd1, fd2));
0075 
0076 %%
0077 % Filldist = 0 if X = Y
0078 
0079 %!test
0080 %! n = 5;
0081 %! for dim = 1:10,
0082 %!     x = rand(n, dim);
0083 %!     fd = stk_filldist(x, x);
0084 %!     assert(stk_isequal_tolabs(fd, 0.0));
0085 %! end
0086 
0087 %%
0088 % Filldist = norm if nx = ny = 1
0089 
0090 %!test
0091 %! for dim = 1:10,
0092 %!     x = rand(1, dim);
0093 %!     y = rand(1, dim);
0094 %!     fd = stk_filldist(x, y);
0095 %!     assert(stk_isequal_tolabs(fd, norm(x - y)));
0096 %! end
0097 
0098 %%
0099 % Filldist = max(dist) if ny = 1
0100 
0101 %!test
0102 %! n = 4;
0103 %! for dim = 2:10,
0104 %!     x = zeros(n, dim);
0105 %!     y = rand(1, dim);
0106 %!     fd = stk_filldist(x, y);
0107 %!     assert(stk_isequal_tolabs(fd, max(stk_dist(x, y))));
0108 %! end
